plugins.name: Variables export to Gitlab
plugins.description:
Figma Variables Export Plugin Instruction


The Figma Variables plugin was developed to convert Figma Variables into SASS variables. 

To use this plugin you should have some Local variables in your Figma project


The plugin has 2 features:

  1. Export file with SASS variables in .scss format
  2. Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request


Export file with SASS variables in .scss format

For exporting Figma Local Variables as SASS variables you just need to click the Export button


By clicking on the ‚ÄòExport‚Äô button the file with .scss extension will be created. It will contain all Figma local variables in SASS format.


This file can be used in the UI project that uses SASS variables. After any changes in Figma Local Variables all is needed is just to make export of variables into the project directory again and the state of Local Variables will be synchronized with the state of SASS variables in the UI project.


Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request

This feature is more advanced. It suggests that SASS variables are placed in some file that is stored in a Gitlab repository. For using this feature we need to set our Gitlab settings:


  1. Gitlab Domain (gitlab.com or another)
  2. Gitlab Token (user can get it from Gitlab settings)
  3. Target branch where you should create a merge request with changes
  4. Path to file with variables (i.e. src/variables.scss)
  5. Project Id (user can see it on gitlab project's page)


By clicking on Publish button the plugin performs the next steps:

  1. Creates new branch for updates
  2. Editing the .scss file from the File Path input
  3. Creates a merge request with changes in this file from just created branch into the Target Branch


After that a person who has permissions of merging can open Gitlab, check changes and merge them.


This feature makes UI project synchronization with Figma mockups more seamless and stable. After making any changes in Figma variables, UX Designer needs only click the Publish button, and UI developer needs only check these changes in Gitlab and click Merge Changes button.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to .scss file of push them to file in Gitlab repository

plugins.name: Mermaid-to-Flow
plugins.description:
Transform Mermaid markup into professional FigJam flowcharts with smart layouts, text wrapping, edge labels, and industry-standard color coding.


Features:

‚Ä¢ Smart hierarchical layouts with automatic positioning

‚Ä¢ Professional color coding (green start, red end, yellow decisions)

‚Ä¢ Edge labels for annotated workflows (A -->|"label"| B)

‚Ä¢ Shape-specific text wrapping for clean diagrams

‚Ä¢ Support for rectangles [text], diamonds {text}, and ellipses (text)

‚Ä¢ Both top-down (TD) and left-right (LR) layouts

‚Ä¢ No external dependencies - works entirely within FigJam


Perfect for business process documentation, software workflows, and technical diagrams. Simply paste your Mermaid code and generate publication-ready flowcharts instantly.
plugins.tagline: Convert Mermaid markup to FigJam flowcharts

137859.release_notes:
## [2.7.1] - 2025-06-15

### üêõ Critical Bug Fixes
- **Fixed standalone node parsing**: Now correctly parses both standalone node definitions and edge connections
  - **Issue**: Nodes were displaying IDs (Q, C, T) instead of text labels ("Pick a drink", "Coffee", "Tea")
  - **Root cause**: Parser only processed edge connections, ignored standalone node definitions
  - **Solution**: Enhanced parser to handle both `Q{Pick a drink}` definitions AND `Q --> C` connections
- **Complete syntax support**: All node types now correctly display text labels
  - `[Rectangle text]` ‚úÖ
  - `{Diamond text}` ‚úÖ 
  - `(Ellipse text)` ‚úÖ
  - `([Ellipse text])` ‚úÖ (both ellipse syntaxes supported)

### üîß Code Quality Improvements
- **Removed dead code**: Eliminated unused `_calculateLegacyLayout()` function (39 lines removed)
- **Optimized function signatures**: Removed unused `levels` parameter from `resolveNodeCollisions()`
- **Consolidated configuration**: Created unified `SHAPE_CONFIG` object for all node types
  - **Before**: Scattered across `getShapeTextConfig()`, `getNodeColors()`, `getShapeType()`
  - **After**: Single source of truth with `SHAPE_CONFIG` and `ROLE_COLORS` objects
- **Enhanced documentation**: Added comprehensive JSDoc comments for all public functions
- **Improved linting**: Created `.eslintignore` to exclude generated `code.js` file

### üß™ Testing & Validation
- **Extensive test coverage**: Verified with 5 diverse Mermaid test cases
  - Mixed node types with edge labels ‚úÖ
  - Left-right layouts with long text ‚úÖ
  - Complex branching decision trees ‚úÖ
  - Simple linear processes ‚úÖ
  - Multiple start/end points ‚úÖ
- **Version logging**: Added console logging to verify latest code is running
- **Clean builds**: All code compiles without errors and passes linting

### üìä Benefits
- ‚úÖ **Correct text display** - All node text labels now show properly instead of IDs
- ‚úÖ **Complete Mermaid support** - Both standalone definitions and edge syntax work perfectly
- ‚úÖ **Maintainable codebase** - Cleaner code with consolidated configuration and documentation
- ‚úÖ **Production ready** - Robust parsing handles real-world Mermaid syntax patterns
- ‚úÖ **Developer experience** - JSDoc documentation and clean code structure

plugins.name: Layout Switch
plugins.description:
Layout Switch will help you save 95% of your time in switching your UI layouts from LTR layout to RTL or vise versa! Select how many frames you want and choose your destination layout and click on the button. BOOOOM! all the layouts are changed!

Layout Switch is your ultimate Figma plugin for effortlessly converting designs between left-to-right (LTR) and right-to-left (RTL) layouts. Whether you're adapting English designs for Arabic, Persian, or Hebrew, or flipping RTL layouts back to LTR, this plugin makes the process fast, precise, and hassle-free. With support for multiple frames at once, Layout Switch is the perfect tool for designers working on global projects.


üñºÔ∏è Multi-Frame Support:

Select a single frame or a bunch of frames at once! The plugin handles multiple selections effortlessly, making it perfect for large projects with numerous screens or components.


‚ú® Blazing Fast Conversion:

Transform your designs in seconds‚Äîno more wasting time on manual tweaks. Whether you're converting LTR to RTL or RTL to LTR, it‚Äôs as fast as a blink!


üõ†Ô∏è Easy to Use:

No complex settings or learning curves. Just select your frames, choose your direction (LTR to RTL or RTL to LTR), click "Convert," and watch the magic happen. We also have two side-plugins that run directly!


üåç Bidirectional Flexibility:

Works seamlessly in both directions‚Äîconvert LTR to RTL for Arabic, Persian, or Hebrew, or flip RTL layouts back to LTR for English or other left-writing languages.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


How It Works:

1.Select Frames: Choose one or multiple frames in your Figma project.

2.Choose Direction: Select whether you want to convert LTR to RTL or RTL to LTR.

3.Click on Change Direction: Run the plugin and let it flip your designs instantly.

4.Review & Polish: Enjoy perfectly adapted layouts, ready for further refinement or delivery.


Note: You save at least 95% your time changing layouts by using Layout Switch. Put your 5% effort on little handy modificationüòâ

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Choose Layout Switch?

‚Ä¢Save Time: What used to take hours or days now takes seconds.

‚Ä¢Boost Productivity: Focus on creativity, not manual adjustments.

‚Ä¢Global Reach: Effortlessly design for both LTR and RTL languages, including Arabic, Persian, Hebrew, and more.

‚Ä¢Bidirectional Power: The only plugin you‚Äôll need for flipping designs in both directions.



Perfect For:

‚Ä¢Designers working on multilingual or global projects.

‚Ä¢Teams adapting designs for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew, English, or other bidirectional languages.

‚Ä¢Anyone looking to streamline their Figma workflow and save time.



Get Started Now!

Stop struggling with manual conversions. Layout Switch is here to make your design process faster, smarter, and more efficient. Whether you're flipping LTR to RTL or RTL to LTR, this plugin has you covered. Try it today and see the difference!



Support the Plugin

‚ù§Ô∏è Love Layout Switch?

If this plugin has made your design process easier, consider supporting its development with a small donation. Your contribution helps keep the plugin updated and free for everyone!

Have Questions or Suggestions?


We‚Äôd love to hear from you! Whether you have feedback, suggestions for new features, or just need help, feel free to reach out.

üìß Contact Us: sabernooriusb@gmail.com

plugins.name: Nova Variable Finder
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you find and locate nodes that use specific Figma variables in your document.


Features


Node Finder

  1. Search for nodes using a variable ID (e.g. VariableID:1:335)
  2. Search for nodes using a variable name
  3. Click on results to select and zoom to the node in your document
  4. Supports all types of variable bindings


Deleted Variable Finder

Search for deleted variables in your document. Deleted variables are the variables that have been deleted from your variables collection but are referenced in somewhere in your document.


Note: This feature uses the Figma API to search for deleted variables. Unfortunately this API is only available for Entreprise tier client.


How to use


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Click on the "Deleted Variable Finder" tab
  3. Provide the your file ID and your personal access token
  4. Click on the "Search" button
  5. The plugin will search for deleted variables in your document and display the results in the "Results" section
  6. Click on a variable name to search for all the nodes that use this variable in your document
  7. Click on a node to select and zoom to the node in your document
plugins.tagline: Find variables in your file.

plugins.name: Auto Select
plugins.description:
Auto Select is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by providing advanced selection tools. With Auto Select, you can easily select objects by name and hierarchy, making it effortless to navigate and manipulate complex designs. Whether you're working on a small project or a large-scale design system, Auto Select is the perfect companion to enhance your productivity and creativity in Figma.


Key Features:


Select objects by name: Quickly find and select objects by entering their names.

Select parent and child layers: Navigate through the hierarchy of your design by selecting parent or child layers.

Undo selection: Easily undo selections to refine your choices.

Select all: Select all objects in your current Figma canvas with a single click.

Close plugin: Close the plugin window when you're done selecting objects.


You can select child layers of selected object and then parent layer of selected child layer .


How to Use:


Enter the name of the object you want to select in the input field.

Click on the "Select Object" button to select the object.

Use the other buttons to perform various selection actions, such as selecting all objects, selecting parent layers, selecting child layers, undoing selections, and closing the plugin.

Get Started with Auto Select today and take your Figma workflow to the next level!
plugins.tagline: "Effortless Selection, Seamless Design: Auto Select simplifies your Figma workflow."

plugins.name: Component Pro
plugins.description:
To improve my work efficiency, especially in mastering the Component, I made this plugin. It contains many enhancements for Figma‚Äôs Component and Instance features.


Just to be clear, I am not very good at HTML and TypeScript, some code was written by chatGPT, so welcome to feedback by sending mail to woshixwn@gmail.com.


Here is a detailed introduction to each function of the plugin.


Track Com/Ins

Change the current selection to correspond to the Component/Instance.

You need to select some instances or components first. For instances, run this function will change selection to their main components, but will not change viewport. For components, will select corresponding instances.

Of course, corresponding components/instances need to be in the same page.


Track Brothers

Find instances with the same main component.

Select Instances, and run this function, all instances that has the main component will be selected.

Be aware that if the page has many layers, it may take a lot of time.


Clone & Inherit

Batch replace layers with specific instance.

First, Select a component or an instance named ‚Äúmaster‚Äù.

Second, select more layers.

Third, run the function, and the layers selected in 2nd step will replace to 1st step‚Äôs instance (create by component or clone by ‚Äòmaster‚Äô instance).

If you choose to select other instances in 2nd step, if it has the same properties as 1st step component/instance, replaced instance will keep the value.


Text2Instances

Batch replace text layers with specific instance.

This function is a lot like ‚Äò‚ÄôClone & Inherit‚Äô, but the layers be replaced need to be text or a combination of texts.

For example, select a component which has 2 text properties, and select a frame contains 2 text layers, then run this function, the frame will be replace to instance created by component, with text properties being assigned to characters of those 2 text layers.


Fully Detach

Detach an instance and the instance inside

I think the description is simple enough, but just in case, let me give an example.

If you have an instance, it has 2 sub-layer, all is instance. Once you run this function, instance and its sub-instances will all be detached.

By the way, the layer that is hidden will be removed, otherwise it looks to mess.


Update ins Inside

Select all instances can be updated

Select some Frames, Groups, Components or even Instances first. Running this function will find out all instances belong to those that can be updated.

Noticed, It may take a long time to analysis each instance type sub-layers, I still try to improve that.


Comp Selection

Make selection a component

This function will make it a component by your selection, replace the selection with an instance that created by the new component.

Make sure that all selection are belong to the same parent.


--------


Next, some features may not exactly made for component, but they also useful(and I really don‚Äôt want to code another plugin).


Auto Rename

Rename selected layers and their sub-layers


Swap Layer

Exchange the position of selected layers


Make Max

Quickly set the size of selected layer to their parents‚Äô size.


Sort Layer

Change the order in left side panel of selected layers by their position.


Perfect Corner

Quickly set selected layers‚Äô independent corners to 60%(iOS like).


Round Pixel

Round layer‚Äôs position and width/height to Pixel


Adjust Outer Size

Adjust Component Set, Section, Frame‚Äôs size according to their sublayers.

I know Figma has its own official feature, but I made an adjustment, the adjust margin will choose the minimum value.



That's all for now, I guess.
plugins.tagline: Component, Instance, Enhancement

103754.release_notes:
I add some ux improvement in this version:

1. List item(Like 'Track Components') now is only enable when available layers are selected. For example, if you select a component, you can't click "Track Components" now. Reducing the risk to click wrong feature.
2. Split "Track Com/Ins" into 2 functions, Track Components and Track Instances. The reason is the same as above.
3. Add new feature, Clone Main Comp, it will clone main components of instances selected.
4. Update ins inside now has a loading state when analysis layers, cause it may take long time.
5. texts2instances now support nested instances
6. I add each function to menu's sub-menu, so you can use command+/ then type function name to quick execute it.

plugins.name: Stream Screen Manager
plugins.description:
Stream Screen Manager revolutionizes the way fast food restaurants manage their digital signage displays. Created by Stream, a leading digital signage company, this Figma Plugin bridges the gap between design and dynamic content management for digital menu boards and drive-thrus. This innovative tool is designed to streamline the content management process, enabling restaurants to update their digital signage directly from Figma - the world‚Äôs premier design tool.

With Stream Screen Manager, users can effortlessly create captivating digital signage layouts tailored to their brand. The plugin facilitates real-time editing of menu pricing, text descriptions, photos, and more, ensuring that your digital displays always reflect the most current offerings and promotions. Whether you‚Äôre looking to make quick updates to your menu or overhaul your drive-thru‚Äôs digital experience, this plugin provides all the tools necessary to achieve your goals with ease.

Key Features:

Real-Time Content Management: Directly update menu items, prices, and promotions across all your digital signage from within Figma. Changes are reflected instantly on your displays, keeping your content fresh and engaging.

Seamless POS Integration: Streamline operations with our plugin‚Äôs ability to integrate directly with Point of Sale systems, ensuring price and menu item consistency across your digital displays and sales channels.

Customizable Templates: Access a library of customizable design templates specifically crafted for fast food restaurants, making it easy to maintain brand consistency across all your signage.

Drag-and-Drop Interface: Utilize Figma‚Äôs intuitive drag-and-drop interface to design your digital signage layouts. Easily add photos, text, and pricing information without needing advanced design skills.

Collaboration Made Simple: Collaborate in real-time with your team members on signage designs. Figma‚Äôs collaborative environment ensures that everyone can contribute to the final product, from marketers to graphic designers.

Stream Screen Manager is perfect for fast food restaurants looking to take control of their digital signage content with the flexibility and power of Figma. Say goodbye to outdated menus and hello to a dynamic, engaging customer experience with Stream Screen Manager. Transform your digital menu boards and drive-thrus today, and serve up the freshest content with ease.

plugins.name: Summary Sprint
plugins.description:
Summary Sprint is a user-friendly FigJam plugin designed to streamline your sprint planning and tracking‚Äîall within your favorite collaborative space. Instantly generate a clear overview of planned, completed, and unfinished tasks, visualized as color-coded cards for quick understanding. Choose the estimation method that best fits your team, from Fibonacci points to hours or any numeric values, ensuring a perfect match for your workflow.


How it Works:


Set Up Your Board:

  1. Add sticky notes (STICKY) with tasks and assign effort values.
  2. Group tasks and place them inside a Section.


Run the Plugin:

  1. Generate the Summary Sprint to view your sprint progress in real-time.
  2. Planned, done, and incomplete tasks are presented in distinct color-coded cards.


Track and Iterate:

  1. Review unplanned work and incomplete tasks to improve future sprints.
  2. Add neutral Notes cards for ideas, dependencies, or clarifications without affecting metrics.


Want to learn more?

Check out our Playground for a deeper explanation and additional tips. With Summary Sprint, you can effortlessly plan, visualize, and refine your sprints directly in FigJam.


Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è in Poland.

accepted.description: Product Design ‚ú¶ at blues brackets.

plugins.name: PixelCast: Create aesthetic design timelpases
plugins.description:
PixelCast: Your Fast, Simple Tool for Figma Timelapses

  1. üé® Craft Timelapses in 3 Clicks ‚Äì Perfect for your social media, portfolio, or website
  2. üé¨ One-Click Export ‚Äì Save and share as video in an instant
  3. üì£ Showcase Your Design Process ‚Äì Let the world see the journey, not just the result


Static is Boring. Show the Process.

Design isn‚Äôt just about the finished product; it‚Äôs about every stroke, nudge, and tweak along the way. PixelCast lets you capture each creative choice, each imperfect draft, and every ‚Äòaha‚Äô moment that brings it all together.


A screenshot is worth a 1000 words. A timelapse is worth a 1000 moments.‚Ä®

We love a good screenshot too, but the real story? That‚Äôs in the details‚Äîthe imperfect ellipses, the text with the font-spacing slightly off, and all the iterations in between. PixelCast lets you share your true design workflow.


How to use the plugin:


  1. Pick a Frame in Figma and click ‚ÄúStart Recording.‚Äù
  2. Design Away! Tweak, adjust, polish, and when you‚Äôre done, hit ‚ÄúStop Recording.‚Äù
  3. Download Your Timelapse Video ‚ú®


Features


Pixel-Perfect Export

Your timelapse videos look exactly like they do in Figma‚Äîclick to export, and you‚Äôre good to go!


Super Lightweight‚Ä®

PixelCast videos are optimized for easy sharing on social media with ultra-light file sizes.


Smart Capture‚Ä®

PixelCast only records changes, so you can take your time to think without filling up frames.


Contact


Got feedback or found a bug? Email us at emailforyash@gmail.com.

plugins.name: AI Page Manager
plugins.description:
AI Page Manager is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your page management workflow. With this tool, you can effortlessly rename, add, delete, and reorder pages in your Figma file, all from a single, intuitive interface.


Key features:

1. Batch Rename: Quickly rename multiple pages at once.

2. Add Pages: Create new pages with custom names in just a few clicks.

3. Delete Pages: Remove unwanted pages easily and safely.

4. Reorder Pages: Drag and drop to rearrange your pages in any order you prefer.

5. Add Separators: Organise your pages with visual separators for better structure.

6. Refresh: Sync your plugin view with the latest changes in your Figma file.


How to use:

1. Open the plugin to see a list of all pages in your current Figma file.

2. To rename a page, simply type the new name in the input field next to the current page name.

3. To add a new page, click the "+" button and enter a name for your new page.

4. To delete a page, click the trash can icon next to the page you want to remove.

5. To reorder pages, drag and drop the pages into your desired sequence.

6. To add a separator, click the "Add Separator" button.

7. Once you've made your changes, click "Apply Changes" to update your Figma file.

8. Use the refresh button to sync the plugin with any external changes made to your file.


The AI Page Manager also includes a teaser for upcoming AI-powered features, hinting at future enhancements that will make your page management even more efficient.


Whether you're working on a small project or a complex design system with numerous pages, AI Page Manager helps you keep your Figma files organized and your workflow smooth. Say goodbye to tedious page management and hello to a more productive design process!
plugins.tagline: Easily rename, add, delete and reorder pages in your Figma file.

plugins.name: Sticky Status
plugins.description:
Status block for frames or components to assist in project status tracking and status note taking. This plugin allows you to add a block that is attached to your page/frame to allows you to set a status and leave comments/notes about the status.


The following statuses are supported currently:

  • Draft
  • In Progress
  • Ready for Review
  • Under Review
  • Approved
  • Ready for Development
  • Not Needed


NOTE: At this time, this plugin will not work with instances. Instances don't allow modification so the plugin is unable to add the status widget to the frame. In order to make this work, you can wrap your instance in a frame and then apply the status. You can add an auto-layout with all 0s for spacing and it will not impact the layout or design.
plugins.tagline: Sticky status blocks for frames and components.

plugins.name: TypeGrid
plugins.description:
TypeGrid allows you to:

  1. Generate a typescale: Choose your base font size, ratio, and number of steps, and the plugin instantly creates a preview of your typescale.
  2. Apply a baseline grid: Set your baseline unit and rounding mode, and the plugin ensures your text layers align perfectly to the grid.
  3. Create text layers: With a single click, generate text layers for each step in your typescale, automatically named and styled.
  4. Create text styles: Generate Figma text styles for each step in your typescale, making it easy to apply consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Preview with custom fonts: See how your typescale looks with any font installed on your system, including different weights.
  6. Fine-tune your settings: Adjust your typescale and baseline grid settings in real-time to get the perfect look for your design.
  7. Save time and ensure consistency: Automate the tedious process of creating and managing typescales and baseline grids, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs.
plugins.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

plugins.name: Quick Roblox UI Exporter by Solys
plugins.description:
How it Works:

  1. Name the files inside Figma you want to export as one of the keywords: 'Frame' , 'Button', 'Icon', etc
  2. Preferably use a 1920x1080 background behind your UI, for example have the settings frame UI on a 1920x1080 background, group it together and name it 'Settings'
  3. The plugin will export and auto organize, you'll receive a file with Settings screen inside, an import reference for the Settings screen and all assets needed inside. Saving you hours on big projects as you can select 20, 30 screens at once and click export!


Why You‚Äôll Love It:


‚ö° One-Click Export ‚Äì Select the UI screens you want to export and click the button


üìÅ Neatly Organized ‚Äì Auto-sorts files by screens for easy access, all stored nicely in a zipped folder


‚è≥ Saves Time ‚Äì Focus on design, not file management & exporting


‚úÖ Hassle-Free ‚Äì Works seamlessly with any project, automatically detects UI it needs to export by it's name, if it contains following keywords in it's name the plugin will automatically export the UI as a PNG file:

Frame

Button

Icon

UI

Scroll

Line

Title

Subtitle

Captions don't matter just include the keyword into one of those UIs you made and it'll export it automatically, you also have it nicely named for easy work with importing.


üîç Auto-Upscaled (3x) ‚Äì Maintains perfect quality for Roblox imports.


üìå Import References ‚Äì Each screen automatically gets an import image reference to guide the user for seamless Roblox importing.



üéØ Try it now & simplify your workflow!
plugins.tagline: Export & auto organize whole game UI projects in seconds
